com.brightcove.drm.widevine

Class RemoveRightsTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.os.AsyncTask<Source,java.lang.Void,java.lang.Integer>
      • com.brightcove.drm.widevine.RemoveRightsTask

  • public class RemoveRightsTask
extends android.os.AsyncTask<Source,java.lang.Void,java.lang.Integer>
    This class removes rights for the given rights-protected Source. This is an asynchronous task. The result of the request will be retrieved from the onInfoListener handler. On success the onInfoListener will emit a DrmInfoEvent.TYPE_RIGHTS_REMOVED. The Widevine documentation is unclear what event fires on failure. However, the return value of this task is either ERROR_NONE on success or ERROR_UNKNOWN on failure. If you required to know whether removing rights was successful or not, you could block and wait for a result by calling get(). It is advised that either wrap it in another AsyncTask such as not to block, or rewrite this class and emit your own success/error handlers. To map an event to a Source, you can call the DrmEvent's getMessage() method which will return the source's URL. Example usage 
     Source source = new Source("http://example.com/video.wvm");
 mDrmManagerClient.setOnInfoListener(new DrmManagerClient.OnInfoListener() {
     public void onInfo(DrmManagerClient drmManagerClient, DrmInfoEvent event) {
         if (event.getType() == DrmInfoEvent.TYPE_RIGHTS_REMOVED) {
             if (event.getMessage() == source.getUrl()) {
                 // removed rights for source
             }
         }
      }
 });
 AsyncTask<Source, Void, Integer> task = new RemoveRightsTask(mDrmManagerClient);
 task.execute(source);
    Blocking example. You should not do this unless in a background thread. 
     Source source = new Source("http://example.com/video.wvm");
 AsyncTask<Source, Void, Integer> task = new RemoveRightsTask(mDrmManagerClient);
 Integer result = task.execute(source).get();
 if (result == ERROR_NONE) {
   // successfully removed rights
 } else {
   // failed to remove rights
 }
